content.description: 7 bolts to chains
content.location: left side, 3rd route to the left of The Roach

content.description: Under the Influence is squeezed in between Dump Truck and Red Hair. It's not one of the easier 12a's at the Creek, but it deserves more traffic than it gets.
content.location: Middle of Main Wall, between Dump Truck and Red Hair.

content.description: A brilliant, steep endurance climb with a no-hands rest at the midway point. Scramble up the blocky corner to the high first bolt.  Now you'll make fun, gymnastic moves to jugs, then one V3 move before the rest. Milk that rest, then make a 5.11 traverse around the corner and bear down for 3 bolts of steep 5.12 climbing. After the crux, the holds get much better, but the roof gets steeper. The chains are just over the lip of the roof.
content.protection: Permadraws, chains with lower-off biners on top. All the permadraws on this route have new dogbones and steel biners as of July 2015. As with all permadraw-equipped routes, you should still check the biners for grooving as you climb!
content.location: Starts in the somewhat chossy, blocky corner on the right side of Main Wall. Look for the obvious dihedral that starts at 1/3 height, just right of Russian Arête.

content.description: 12 bolts to chains
content.location: Follows the obvious arête where the wall steepens on the right side.

content.description:
Start on the flake and follow it up until you reach the crux (4th bolt) then traverse right to the rail and continue upwards.

The Roach is many of climbers first 5.11, and serves as the cliffs warm up. There's a two bolt extension after the anchors that goes at 11b.
content.protection: 6 lead bolts, 2 anchor bolts. 1st bolt is a stud bolt with ring hanger in poor condition, installed 1995. Bolt 2-6 and anchor bolts are SS stud bolt with SS hanger in good condition, installed 2014.
content.location: It's definitely the most obvious route down there, right on the flake, right in the middle of everything.

content.description: A steep lower half feeds into a technical open book dihedral which overs a few timely rests after the steep lower half. Save some for clipping the anchors, with some creative footwork clipping the anchors can be pretty easy.
content.location: 3rd route lookers right of the Roach. Look for the less fractured dihedral on the routes upper half.

content.description: Pumpy endurance boulder traverse of the whole wall. Ends below the bitten, and can be climbed left-to-right or right-to-left
content.location: Traverse of the Main wall. Starts or ends below The Bitten.

content.description: A long route with blocky edges and steep pockets. This is an area classic!
content.location: Far right side of Main Wall

content.description: Looks hard- I'll try to add a description later. I believe this has only seen a couple sends.
content.location: 2nd from the right on main wall

content.description: A stout boulderly lower portion leads to a short juggy section prior to a delicate slab.  Finishes on lower angle terrain near a seam underneath the (15)Russian Arete
content.protection: Ten lead bolts, and two anchor bolts, all ClimbTech Wave Bolts in excellent condition. Installed June 2019.
content.location: Second route left of the blocky corner that separates Main Wall from the taller pillar on the right. Shares the chains with Opiate and Crawford's route.

content.description: Don't miss this classic! Sustained and crimpy climbing for the first 5 bolts (but with great clipping holds), then a two bolt technical crux. The rest of the climbing is a techy slab heading up and right, then finishing on the Overhangus chains.
content.protection: Ten lead bolts and two anchor bolts.
content.location: Just to the right of the Red Hair dihedral. Shares chains with Overhangus.

content.description:
This brilliant route begins with a steep polished section followed by a nice rest before moving slightly left into a "c" shaped shallow corner system.  Difficult slopers and small crimps lead to a tricky to clip 5th bolt.  Working out the sequence through here is key to the send.  Pull through a small and juggy bulge continuing on jugs to a nice rest (routes original finish).  Now move right onto some nice face climbing finishing by pulling over a small roof.

*Note:  Naked Man was Deep Creek's 1st route*
content.location: One route left of (7) Belly Rubber. The route's middle section is recognized via a "C" shaped corner system capped with a mini bulge.

content.description: 7 bolts to chains
content.location: far left on Main Wall

content.description: Shares the first 4 bolts of Being Inferior then splits right for 4 bolts. Rejoins 'Being' at the top. It's a bit more sustained than Being, with a cruxy section right after the split.
content.location: Shares the start of Being Inferior

content.description: Reachy and bouldery
content.protection: 10 bolts to chains with lower-offs on top. All the permadraws on this route have new dogbones and steel biners as of July 2015. As with all permadraw-equipped routes, you should still check the biners for grooving as you climb!
content.location: Starts on Russian Arête and cuts right at about the 7th bolt.

content.description: Said to be a very good route. Starts on Bitten, then at 1/3 height stay right of the arete.
content.location: On the right side of Main Wall. Look for the obvious arête that starts at 1/3 height.

content.description: The direct finish to The Being Inferior.
content.location: 3rd route from the left on Main Wall

content.description: From Bachelor's Week to the corner below Russian Arête and back again. Pretty fun to work on. Much of it is do-able in sections by mere mortals and you can go till pumped, then drop to a soft, sandy landing.
content.location: The whole length of Main Wall and back.

content.description: Making it through the hard and extremely thin sequence down low is rewarded with a juggy horizontal ledge, milk this slight rest as you battle the pump factor to the anchor.
content.protection: 8 lead bolts and 2 anchor bolts, all ClimbTech Wave Bolts in excellent condition installed June 2019.
content.location: One route to the right of The Roach

content.description: This one is atypical for Deep Creek. There is a crux at the 3rd clip, and some tricky moves interspersed with great rests. The angle eases off at the 4th bolt, but the climbing stays interesting to the chains.
content.protection:
Bolts to chains

The draws are fixed on the upper half, but you'll currently need 4 or 5 of your own draws to lead it.
content.location: Just to the left of Russian arête. Shares chains with Overhangus.

content.description: You will find Bitten in the blocky corner where the steep pillar joins the rest of Main Wall. (3rd bolt line from the right). Start up the ugly corner of chossy looking blocks. The first half of the climb is 5.11 and below- gymnastic and fun!. After a no-hands rest, the business begins. Steep 5.12 climbing is capped by a steeper roof and a hard boulder problem. The last clip at the roof is desperate, most choose to skip it. This is a Deep Creek classic!
content.protection: 10 perma-draws to chains with lower-off biners on top. All the permadraws on this route have new dogbones and steel biners as of July 2015. As with all permadraw-equipped routes, you should still check the biners for grooving as you climb!
content.location: 3rd bolted line from the right on Main Wall. After the no-hands rest, clip the 7th bolt then split off from Spineless, moving up and right. Shares the boulder problem finish of Quiver (13c).

content.description: A boulder problem off the ground and a high first bolt. Then easy climbing (and rests) for 15 ft.  Is followed by progressively harder climbing until about the 8th bolt, where holds get larger and more positive.  The route finishes pulling over a small roof.
content.protection: 12 lead bolts, and 2 anchor bolts. All ClimbTech Wave Bolts in excellent condition, installed July 2019.
content.location: One route left of The Roach, climbing the rib-like feature in the middle of the main wall.

content.description: First bolt is kind of high, but there is a very positive clipping hold right next to the first clip.  Throw down on a bouldery start to a good jug after the 3rd bolt. Then an endurance section to a great rest on a big flake at the 7 th bolt. The route splits left above, and you've got a short crux before 3 or 4 bolts of 5.10 climbing to the chains.
content.protection: bolts to chains. Usually has fixed draws, but as of July '13, there are 4 naked bolts high up that you'll need to bring draws for.
content.location: 3rd route from the left on the main wall. Just right of the detached flake.

content.description: May be a little hard for the grade. The Roach makes a better warm-up for most people.
content.protection: Four lead bolts, two anchor bolts, all ClimbTech Wave bolts, Condition is excellent, bolts installed July 2019.
content.location: On the far left of the Main Wall, it's around the corner from the other routes.
